member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonReader
member.summary: Represents a reader that provides fast, non-cached, forward-only access to serialized Json data.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified .

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.Read
member.summary: Reads the next JSON token from the stream.
member.returns: true if the next token was read successfully; false if there are no more tokens to read.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.ReadAsInt32
member.summary: Reads the next JSON token from the stream as a .
member.returns: A . This method will return null at the end of an array.

member.returns: A . This method will return null at the end of an array.

member.summary: Reads the next JSON token from the stream as a .

member.summary: Reads the next JSON token from the stream as a .

member.summary: Sets the state based on current token type.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.System#IDisposable#Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.Close
member.summary: Changes the to Closed.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.CurrentState
member.summary: Gets the current reader state.
member.value: The current reader state.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.CloseInput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the underlying stream or should be closed when the reader is closed.
member.value: true to close the underlying stream or when the reader is closed; otherwise false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.QuoteChar
member.summary: Gets the quotation mark character used to enclose the value of a string.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.DateTimeZoneHandling
member.summary: Get or set how time zones are handling when reading JSON.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.DateParseHandling
member.summary: Get or set how date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed when reading JSON.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.FloatParseHandling
member.summary: Get or set how floating point numbers, e.g. 1.0 and 9.9, are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.MaxDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth allowed when reading JSON. Reading past this depth will throw a .

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.TokenType
member.summary: Gets the type of the current JSON token.

member.summary: Gets the text value of the current JSON token.

member.summary: Gets the path of the current JSON token.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.Culture
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture used when reading JSON. Defaults to .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.State.Start
member.summary: The Read method has not been called.

member.summary: The end of the file has been reached successfully.

member.summary: Reader is at a property.

member.summary: Reader is in an array.

member.summary: The Close method has been called.

member.summary: Reader has just read a value.

member.summary: Reader is at the start of a constructor.

member.summary: Reader in a constructor.

member.summary: An error occurred that prevents the read operation from continuing.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.State.Finished
member.summary: The end of the file has been reached successfully.

member.summary: Specifies how constructors are used when initializing objects during deserialization by the .

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies float format handling options when writing special floating point numbers, e.g. , and with .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.String
member.summary: Write special floating point values as strings in JSON, e.g. "NaN", "Infinity", "-Infinity".

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.Symbol
member.summary: Write special floating point values as symbols in JSON, e.g. NaN, Infinity, -Infinity. Note that this will produce non-valid JSON.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.DefaultValue
member.summary: Write special floating point values as the property's default value in JSON, e.g. 0.0 for a property, null for a property.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how floating point numbers, e.g. 1.0 and 9.9, are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling.Double
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling.Decimal
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.

member.param: The that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
member.exception: The class name is null or is zero (0).

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies how dates are formatted when writing JSON text.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling.IsoDateFormat
member.summary: Dates are written in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. "2012-03-21T05:40Z".

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling.MicrosoftDateFormat
member.summary: Dates are written in the Microsoft JSON format, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/".

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.None
member.summary: Date formatted strings are not parsed to a date type and are read as strings.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTime
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTimeOffset
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling
member.summary: Specifies how to treat the time value when converting between string and .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Local
member.summary: Treat as local time. If the object represents a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), it is converted to the local time.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Utc
member.summary: Treat as a UTC. If the object represents a local time, it is converted to a UTC.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Unspecified
member.summary: Treat as a local time if a is being converted to a string. If a string is being converted to , convert to a local time if a time zone is specified.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.RoundtripKind
member.summary: Time zone information should be preserved when converting.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.Formatting
member.summary: Specifies formatting options for the .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.Formatting.None
member.summary: No special formatting is applied. This is the default.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.Formatting.Indented
member.summary: Causes child objects to be indented according to the and settings.

member.summary: Specifies how strings are escaped when writing JSON text.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.StringEscapeHandling.Default
member.summary: Only control characters (e.g. newline) are escaped.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.StringEscapeHandling.EscapeNonAscii
member.summary: All non-ASCII and control characters (e.g. newline) are escaped.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.StringEscapeHandling.EscapeHtml
member.summary: HTML (<, >, &, ', ") and control characters (e.g. newline) are escaped.

member.summary: Adds the specified content immediately after this token.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken.BeforeSelf
